body:
Ha ha sigh.

The problem here is in the normalization used (see [`PlatformOptions.getNormalized`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/PlatformOptions.java;drc=74c8ca4886cfc188d60a18e796743e842f675842;l=180)): it calls into [`dedupeOnly`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/config/FragmentOptions.java?q=symbol%3A%5Cbcom.google.devtools.build.lib.analysis.config.FragmentOptions.dedupeOnly%5Cb%20case%3Ayes), which keeps the **first** instance of the value, and so shows the behavior you report.

This flag (and maybe also `--extra_execution_platforms`?) really wants a currently-doesn't-exist `dedupeOnlyKeepingLast`, instead.

This probably isn't difficult, I'll take a look at it sometime soon.

issue.title: Fix deduping for `--extra_toolchains`.

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Because the semantics of `--extra_toolchains` are that the last entry has highest priority, when deduping we need to keep the **last** entry, not the first.

Since nothing else used `dedupeOnly`, remove that entirely.

Fixes #22912.

issue.title: [7.4.0] Fix deduping for `--extra_toolchains`.

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Because the semantics of `--extra_toolchains` are that the last entry has highest priority, when deduping we need to keep the **last** entry, not the first.

Since nothing else used `dedupeOnly`, remove that entirely.

Fixes #22912.

Closes #23093.

Change-Id: Icb5f70c47814803a1455d6b8512d977fa5f13469

Fixes #23095

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 7.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/7.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting `USE_BAZEL_VERSION=7.4.0rc1`. Thanks!
